intro: Gymnanthes obtusa, commonly known as the blunt gymnanthes, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and the plant often grows in moist, tropical environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
